Here are some variant protocols that I've thought about (see attached file=

f I've well understood :) and Paul Prescod as I remember.
what about the ot=
hers ?
II or III. look more like SMTP
IV. loose the ability to modify the m=
essage after it was sent, but the receiver can get it even if the sender's =
server it offline.
an last variant can be that each client has its own http=
 server, and sender POST to receiver directly, wich sounds more like P2P an=
d IM (interesting, but its an other topic...  :)
